title: Ontology Engineering and Plug-in Development with the NeOn Toolkit

As a quick recap, what we have done today, what we have covered in the morning, we have looked at using the Neon toolkit for ontology engineering.
And in the afternoon we have addressed the topic of plugin development.

How you can build your own plugins extending into look at what we did not cover, but what we will likely do for an additional tutorial is how we can build semantic applications using ontologies at runtime.

What we have seen, at least to some extent, is what it means to do ontology engineering with various phases in the ontology engineering process, requirement analysis, development, integration, evaluation.
We have looked at particular ontology engineering activities and you have also seen some of the plugins that we have available within the new toolkit to support these activities.
